1956

January 26, 2012.

ür. S. C. Luk,

Angola, Indi ana.

My dear Luk:

Your letter of the 23d inst. has reached me and I am glad to learn

that you have recently received funds from home.

I have looked over your

accounts es requested to find just what the situation is.

on November 14th I handed you a statement of your account to that

time showing a deficit or 2134.92.

This deficit did not include a loan of

$250, which I had secured from the Trustees in your favor, consequently to 
the $234.92 referred to should be added $250., plus interest amounting to

$1.88.

on November 20th I sent you at your request a check for $200., and

on December 28th I paid a bill of Dennis Triplett for a suit and overcoat

araounting to $48.50.

As I figuro it this brings the total of your indebt -
odness to $535.30.

Apparently this will leave you very littio from the

draft referred to with which to meet your regular expenses at college.

I

would suggest, therefore, that if it is going to embarrass you to meet the

whole amount at this time, you may send part of it and I will carry the

balance on your account until some later de to when you will find it possi -
ble to clear it up without verious inconvenience.

assuring you of my continued interest in all that pertains to

your welfare, believe me, with cordial personal regards,

Feithfully yours,
